The clinical presentation and severity of symptoms is case-dependent. The clinical characteristics in the Chinese population have been recently documented from 1099 cases.
4 The virus has infected more males than females, and severity is associated with older age. The common symptoms are fever and a persistent non-productive cough, although many present without fever and often with mild symptoms. The vast majority (>85%) do not demonstrate chest radiographic abnormalities, but ground-glass opacity and bilateral shadowing have been demonstrated on computer tomography in severe cases.
